skill.summary: Security validation, vulnerability scanning, and compliance checking.

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only markdown documentation with security guidance and command references. No executable code, network calls, file system access, or external commands are present. The skill provides legitimate security best practices and tool usage documentation.

content.user_title: Validate security and scan for vulnerabilities
content.value_statement: Security vulnerabilities can expose sensitive data and compromise systems. This skill provides commands and checklists for validating encryption keys, running security scanners, and ensuring compliance with security best practices.
actual_capabilities: Validate GPG and SSH encryption keys
Run Bandit security scanner on Python code
Check dependencies for known vulnerabilities with pip-audit and Safety
Execute Semgrep security rules for code analysis
Follow pre-commit and pre-release security checklists
limitations: Does not execute scans automatically - provides command references only
Focused on Python project security patterns
Requires manual review of scan results
Does not fix vulnerabilities - only identifies them

use_cases.title: Run security scans
use_cases.description: Validate code and dependencies before committing changes to repository

use_cases.title: Audit project security
use_cases.description: Perform comprehensive security audit including key validation and dependency scanning

use_cases.title: Ensure compliance
use_cases.description: Verify security checklist completion before release deployment

prompt_templates.title: Scan for vulnerabilities
prompt_templates.scenario: When you need to check code security
prompt_templates.prompt: Run security scan on this project using Bandit, pip-audit, and Safety. Report any vulnerabilities found.

prompt_templates.title: Validate encryption keys
prompt_templates.prompt: Validate that GPG signing and SSH keys are properly configured for this repository.

prompt_templates.title: Review security checklist
prompt_templates.prompt: Check if this project meets the pre-release security checklist requirements.

prompt_templates.title: Apply OWASP guidelines
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this code against OWASP Top 10 considerations and identify any potential security issues.

output_examples.input: Run security scan on this project
output: Bandit Scan Results: No high-severity issues found
Recommendations: Enable git signing for commits

best_practices: Run security scans before every commit to catch issues early
Validate encryption keys monthly to ensure they have not expired or been revoked
Address all vulnerabilities identified by scanners before release
anti_patterns: Skipping security scans to save time during deadline pressure
Ignoring low-severity warnings that could indicate deeper issues
Using personal encryption keys for shared project accounts

faq.question: What tools does this skill use?
faq.answer: Bandit for Python security scanning, pip-audit and Safety for dependency vulnerabilities, Semgrep for static analysis, and GPG/SSH validation.

faq.question: Does this skill modify my code?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides command references and guidance only. It does not execute scans or make changes to your codebase.

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude and Claude Code. It activates on security-related keywords in your prompts.

faq.question: Is my data safe when running scans?
faq.answer: Yes. Scans run locally on your machine using installed tools. No code or data is sent to external services.

faq.question: What if vulnerabilities are found?
faq.answer: The skill reports findings for you to address manually. This includes updating dependencies, fixing code patterns, or applying security controls.

faq.question: How is this different from CI security checks?
faq.answer: This skill provides immediate feedback during development. CI checks run after commits. Both approaches complement each other for comprehensive security.
